title: Express Shares Retreat After Trading Resumes
sub_head: Buying frenzy from individual investors had sent clothing retailer’s shares soaring
body:
Fast fashion retailer Express Inc.’s shares fell sharply Thursday afternoon after trading resumed following a halt earlier in the day due to volatility.
The halt followed a social media-fueled buying frenzy that started with shares of videogame retailer GameStop . With trading resumed, Express shares dropped to $4.64 Thursday afternoon from a high of $13.97 a share on Wednesday. The shares had closed on Tuesday at just over $3.
Express, like many bricks-and-mortar retailers, especially ones selling clothes for office wear, has struggled since the coronavirus pandemic started and risked running out of cash.
The Columbus, Ohio-based retailer hired Lazard Freres & Co. to help search for financing to outlast the pandemic, Chief Executive Timothy Baxter said in December.
Earlier this month, Express obtained a $140 million loan facility from private-equity firm Sycamore Partners, Wells Fargo Bank N.A. and Bank of America . Express shares closed at $1.28 a share the day the company announced the financing.
